intro: Anacampseros albissima, commonly known as the white-flowered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It is often grown as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
